Case.description: Type of physical container encapsulating the electrochemical cell. Examples: Cylindrical, Pouch.

EffectiveDensity.description: Density of a porous electrode, calculated from its geometrical volume and mass. It includes the volume occupied by pores.

NominalVoltage.description: Reference voltage of the cell as reported by the manufacturer. Usually calculated from the cell's energy output and capacity under a standard cycling test.

TabFractions.description: Location of the tabs. The location of each tab is given by a fraction which determines the fraction of the total spiral length where the tab is located.

InnerRadius.description: Radius of the rolled electrodes within a cylindrical cell, measured from the center of the cell to the inner side of the cell wall.

OuterRadius.description: Radius of the rolled electrodes within a cylindrical cell, measured from the center of the cell to the outer side of the cell wall.

ElectrodeWidth.description: Dimension of the shortest side of the face of a rectangular electrode.

ElectrodeLength.description: Dimension of the longest side of the face of a rectangular electrode.

SurfaceCoefficientOfHeatTransfer.description: Rate at which heat is exchanged between a cell’s surface and its surrounding environment

ChargeTransferCoefficient.description: Constant alpha in the Butler-Volmer equation. It represents the fraction of the electrostatic potential energy affecting the reduction rate in an electrode reaction, with the remaining fraction affecting the corresponding oxidation rate.

ElectronicDiffusionCoefficient.description: Diffusion coefficient of electrons in a solid.

StoichiometricCoefficient.description: Ratio of the concentration of an intercalant (e.g. Li+) at a given moment, to its maximum possible concentration within a solid host material.

InterstitialConcentration.description: Amount of neutral intersticial sites of the intercalant (Li+) per volume of solid.

InitialThickness.description: Thickness of the SEI layer at the start of the simulation.

InitialPotentialDrop.description: Electric potential difference across the SEI layer or electrode interface at the beginning of the simulation.

Protocol.description: Type of cycling procedure used to cycle a cell. E.g., Constant Current ('CC'), Constant Current - Constant Voltage ('cccv').

FunctionName.description: String of the name of a Julia function.

InitialControl.description: Whether a cycling protocol starts with 'charging' or 'discharging'.

RestingTimeAfterCharge.description: Time during which the cell is kept at open-circuit conditions after charging.

RestingTimeAfterDischarge.description: Time during which the cell is kept at open-circuit conditions after discharging.

TabWidth.description: Dimension of the shortest side of the face of the rectangular tab of a current collector.

TabLength.description: Dimension of the longest side of the face of the rectangular tab of a current collector.

MaximumConcentration.description: The saturation concentration of the guest molecule in the host material

ElectrodeGeometricSurfaceArea.description: Face (or plate) area of an electrode. Electrode cross-sectional area.

VolumetricSurfaceArea.description: Ratio of the electrochemically-active surface area of the electrode per volume of electrode

SpecificHeatCapacity.description: Heat capacity of the material per unit of mass.

ThermalConductivity.description: Material property characterizing its ability to transmit heat through a surface element.

ElectronicConductivity.description: Measure of a material's ability to conduct an electric current.

ActivationEnergyOfReaction.description: Parameter of the empirical Arrhenius formulation, characterizing the exponential temperature dependence of the reaction rate of the material.

ReactionRateConstant.description: Proportionality constant quantifying the rate and direction of a chemical reaction by relating it with the concentration of reactants.

StoichiometricCoefficientAtSOC100.description: Stoichiometry of the intercalant within the host material, at the upper cell voltage limit.

StoichiometricCoefficientAtSOC0.description: Stoichiometry of the intercalant within the host material, at the lower cell voltage limit.

ActivationEnergyOfDiffusion.description: Parameter of the empirical Arrhenius formulation, characterizing the exponential temperature dependence of the diffusion coefficient of the material.

OpenCircuitPotential.description: The open-circuit potential of the active material under a given intercalant stoichimetry and temperature.

AmbientTemperature.description: The ambient temperature of the environment surrounding the electrochemical cell.

InitialTemperature.description: The thermodynamic temperature at some point in time designated to be the initial state.

HeatTransferCoefficient.description: At a point on the surface separating two media with different thermodynamic temperatures, magnitude of the density of heat flow rate divided by the absolute value of temperature difference.

NominalCapacity.description: Expected charge capacity of a cell under standard conditions, as defined by the manufacturer.

DeviceSurfaceArea.description: Total external surface area of an electrochemical device.

Volume.description: Three dimensional space occupied by a material or device.

BruggemanCoefficient.description: Exponent relating the tortuosity and porosity of porous media.

MassFraction.description: Mass of an electrode constituent divided by the total mass of all constituents in the solid mixture.

ChargeNumber.description: Electric charge of an ion divided by the elementary charge.

TransferenceNumber.description: Fraction of the total ionic current in an electrolyte that is carried by lithium ions under the influence of an electric field.

Concentration.description: Moles of the charge carrier species per cubic meter of electrolyte.

IonicConductivity.description: Measure of the ionic conduction of ions in the electrolyte under given concentration and temperature conditions

DiffusionCoefficient.description: Proportionality constant between the molar flux of the charge carrier and its negative concentration gradient in a material.

Thickness.description: The dimension of a battery component measured along the direction of ionic transport, perpendicular to the major surfaces.

StartWithCharge.description: Whether the cell simulation starts with a Charging step.

InitialStateOfCharge.description: State of charge of the cell at the start of a simulation.

TotalNumberOfCycles.description: Total count of charge-discharge cycles executed during the simulation.

DRate.description: An indicator of the electric current at which a cell discharged relative to a defined capacity. 1C corresponds to discharging the entire defined capacity in one hour.

CRate.description: An indicator of the electric current at which a cell discharged relative to a defined capacity. 1C corresponds to charging the entire defined capacity in one hour.

LowerVoltageLimit.description: Minimum voltage limit when the discharge step stops.

UpperVoltageLimit.description: Maximum voltage limit when the charge step stops.

CurrentChangeLimit.description: A control limit placed on the rate of change of the electric current (dI/dt) in a constant-voltage step.

VoltageChangeLimit.description: A control limit placed on the rate of change of the cell voltage (dV/dt) in a constant-current step.

Porosity.description: Ratio of the pore volume to the total volume of a porous material.

NumberOfElectronsTransfered.description: Number of electrons transferred between an electrode and an entity (ion, molecule) during an electrochemical reaction.
